opendial.bn.distribs

Class CategoricalTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.distribs.CategoricalTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndependentProbDistribution, ProbDistribution

    public class CategoricalTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements IndependentProbDistribution
    Representation of a categorical probability table P(X), where X is a random variable.
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Logger log

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CategoricalTable(java.lang.String variable)
      Constructs a new probability table, with no values

      Constructs a new probability table, with no values
      CategoricalTable(java.lang.String variable, java.util.Map<Value,java.lang.Double> headTable)
      Constructs a new probability table with a mapping between head variable assignments and probability values.
      CategoricalTable(java.lang.String variable, java.lang.String uniqueValue)
      Create a categorical table with a unique value with probability 1.0.
      CategoricalTable(java.lang.String variable, Value uniqueValue)
      Create a categorical table with a unique value with probability 1.0.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CategoricalTable

        public CategoricalTable(java.lang.String variable)
        Constructs a new probability table, with no values
        Parameters:
        variable - the name of the random variable

      • CategoricalTable

        public CategoricalTable(java.lang.String variable,
                        boolean addDefaultValue)
        Constructs a new probability table, with no values
        Parameters:
        variable - the name of the random variable
        addDefaultValue - whether to automatically add a default value to fill the remaining probability mass

      • CategoricalTable

        public CategoricalTable(java.lang.String variable,
                        java.util.Map<Value,java.lang.Double> headTable)
        Constructs a new probability table with a mapping between head variable assignments and probability values. The construction assumes that the distribution does not have any conditional variables.
        Parameters:
        variable - the name of the random variable
        headTable - the mapping to fill the table

      • CategoricalTable

        public CategoricalTable(java.lang.String variable,
                        Value uniqueValue)
        Create a categorical table with a unique value with probability 1.0.
        Parameters:
        variable - the name of the random variable
        uniqueValue - the unique value for the table

      • CategoricalTable

        public CategoricalTable(java.lang.String variable,
                        java.lang.String uniqueValue)
        Create a categorical table with a unique value with probability 1.0.
        Parameters:
        variable - the name of the random variable
        uniqueValue - the unique value for the table (as a string)

    • Method Detail

      • addRow

        public void addRow(Value value,
                   double prob)
        Adds a new row to the probability table. If the table already contains a probability, it is erased.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to add
        prob - the associated probability

      • addRow

        public void addRow(java.lang.String value,
                   double prob)
        Adds a new row to the probability table. If the table already contains a probability, it is erased.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to add (as a string)
        prob - the associated probability

        Parameters:

        prob - the associated probability

      • addRow

        public void addRow(boolean value,
                   double prob)

        Parameters:
        value - the value to add (as a boolean)
        prob - the associated probability

      • addRow

        public void addRow(double[] value,
                   double prob)
        Adds a new row to the probability table. If the table already contains a probability, it is erased.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to add (as a double array)
        prob - the associated probability

      • incrementRow

        public void incrementRow(Value head,
                         double prob)
        Increments the probability specified in the table for the given head assignment. If none exists, simply assign the probability.
        Parameters:
        head - the head assignment
        prob - the probability increment

      • addRows

        public void addRows(java.util.Map<Value,java.lang.Double> heads)
        Add a new set of rows to the probability table.
        Parameters:
        heads - the mappings (head assignment, probability value)

        public void removeRow(Value head)
        Removes a row from the table.
        Parameters:
        head - head assignment

        Concatenate the values for the two tables (assuming the two tables share the same variable).

        Returns:
        the table resulting from the concatenation

        returns true if the table contains a probability for the given assignment
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • sample

        public Value sample()
             throws DialException
        Sample a value from the distribution. If no assignment can be sampled (due to e.g. an ill-formed distribution), returns a none value.
        Specified by:
        sample in interface IndependentProbDistribution
        Returns:
        the sampled assignment
        Throws:
        DialException - if no assignment could be sampled

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the continuous equivalent for the distribution
        Throws:

      • getNBest

        public CategoricalTable getNBest(int nbest)
        Returns a subset of the N values in the table with the highest probability.
        Parameters:
        nbest - the number of values to select
        Returns:
        the distribution with the subset of values

      • getBest

        public Value getBest()
        Returns the most likely assignment of values in the table. If none could be found, returns an empty assignment.
        Returns:
        the assignment with highest probability

      • isWellFormed

        public boolean isWellFormed()
        Returns true if the probability table is well-formed. The method checks that all possible assignments for the condition and head parts are covered in the table, and that the probabilities add up to 1.0f.
        Specified by:
        isWellFormed in interface ProbDistribution
        Returns:
        true if the table is well-formed, false otherwise
